title: The Stillwater Solution
premise: In 1987, reclusive puzzle-box inventor Elias Thorne was found dead in his study, the only door locked from the inside and the key in his pocket. Thirty-five years later, his estranged granddaughter, a forensic architect, discovers his final, unsold puzzle box contains not a mechanism, but a perfect miniature replica of the crime scene—with one impossible detail changed.
protagonist: Arden Thorne, a forensic architect who uses 3D modeling to solve spatial contradictions in cold cases.
conflict: Arden must solve the original locked-room murder by deconstructing her grandfather's final puzzle, which seems to deliberately mislead her, while a shadowy collector of impossible artifacts will stop at nothing to obtain the box before she uncovers its truth.
setting: Present-day Portland, Oregon, and flashbacks to a remote, modernist lakeside house in 1987.
tone: Atmospheric, cerebral, and claustrophobic, blending the meticulous detail of a forensic procedural with the haunting legacy of a family secret.
